list_definition.definition: having or showing a feeling of pleasure or contentment

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’d be happy to help you.
By a happy chance I have the key with me.

list_ex_of_english: If he were to have his own way he would be perfectly happy to sit here seven days a week and not move.
It is a fact that, in this century, few happy and harmonious landscapes have been painted by leading artists.
This is not a happy conclusion since presentism does not seem to be the favoured theory among physicists and metaphysicians.
The visitors did not look particularly happy but appeared convinced by these words of reason.
Can we possibly believe that he is doing well just because he is happy and satisfied?
For example, provided there is enough food, choosing to be well nourished would seem easier to achieve than choosing to be happy.
Everyone, after all, could be happy if profits were being made from books that deserved re-issuing.
If the ending is ultimately and abruptly happy, the pathos lingers.
